comments:
When an attachment of size > 32 kilobytes is submitted, Axis2 attempts to cache the file to disk.  However, it uses a path that probably doesn't exist and throws a FileNotFoundException, masked by an IllegalArgumentException.

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal Argument
	at org.apache.axis2.saaj.AttachmentPartImpl.setContent(AttachmentPartImpl.java:218)
	at javax.xml.soap.SOAPMessage.createAttachmentPart(SOAPMessage.java:257)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.soap.XDSSoapClientAXIS2.send(XDSSoapClientAXIS2.java:243)
	at org.eclipse.ohf.ihe.xds.source.Source.submit(Source.java:340)

This bug has been fixed in the Axis2 CVS and should be available in the Axis2 1.2 release.  A workaround is to create a "temp" directory relative to your code's runtime path.  OHF will be updated/fixed upon the Axis2 release.
Can't check-in new Axis2 update because of legal reasons.  Will not fix (remain as documented bug) for this year.  Will close.
